docs.summary: Responsible for authorization of requests in Wix. Currently supports USER Identites only.
Clear all account assigned policies on a site (site id is extracted from context)

members.name: resource
members.doc: A specific resource. We will determine the resource type based on the action.

members.name: siteContext
members.doc: A specific site (we will retrieve the account that the site belongs to)

members.name: accountContext
members.doc: A specific account

members.name: organizationContext
members.doc: A specific organization

docs.summary:
A custom resource. Is used to represent some asset that is not a direct resource context (site or account), but something custom.
 For example: payment method, blog post, domain, logo.

members.name: id
members.doc: The resource id.

members.name: type
members.doc: The resource type

docs.summary: Site resource context. It indicates that the resource is under a site (can be the site itself or some asset of a site, like a blog post)
Account resource contexts. It indicates that the resource is under the account (can be the account itself or some asset of an account, like a logo or a domain)

members.name: accountId
members.doc: specific account

members.name: all
members.doc: all accounts

members.name: context
members.doc: The context of the subject. For example - the context of a user subject is his account.

docs.summary:
Set of key-value pairs. The attributes you pass with the call. If the policy was assigned without any condition, you don't need to pass any attributes.
 If the policy was assigned with a condition, in order to get `isPermitted = true` you need to pass the matching attributes.
 For example - in case there is an `msid` condition on one of the statements (common for account level actions assigned to contributors)
 you need to pass the `msid` the contributor is working on as an attribute, alongside an account resource context.

members.name: key:value
members.doc: `key` of type string, `value` of type object

members.name: permission
members.doc: The permission to check on. All casing will be checked.

members.name: resourceContext
members.doc: The resource context to check on. The context usually matches the level of the action, which can be found in the permission catalog.

members.name: resourceId
members.doc:
Optional id of a specific resource. In case there was an assignment of a policy on a specific resource, the id of the resource should be passed here.
 The type of the resource will be derived from the permission catalog (each permission can have a resource type)

members.name: customAttributes
members.doc:
Set of key-value pairs. The attributes you pass with the call. If the policy was assigned without any condition, you don't need to pass any attributes.
 If the policy was assigned with a condition, in order to get `isPermitted = true` you need to pass the matching attributes.
 For example - in case there is an `msid` condition on one of the statements (common for account level actions assigned to contributors)
 you need to pass the `msid` the contributor is working on as an attribute, alongside an account resource context.

members.name: subject
members.doc: The subject that you want to check whether or not he has restrictions on the assignment

members.name: resources
members.doc: The resource to check on. The context usually matches the level of the action, which can be found in the permission catalog.

members.name: permission
members.doc: The permission to check on. All casing will be checked.

members.name: resources
members.doc: The resources you want to check on. Limited to 50 resources per request.

docs.summary:
Set of key-value pairs. The attributes you pass with the call. If the policy was assigned without any condition, you don't need to pass any attributes.
 If the policy was assigned with a condition, in order to get `isPermitted = true` you need to pass the matching attributes.
 For example - in case there is an `msid` condition on one of the statements (common for account level actions assigned to contributors)
 you need to pass the `msid` the contributor is working on as an attribute, alongside an account resource context.

members.name: key:value
members.doc: `key` of type string, `value` of type object

members.name: resourceContext
members.doc: The resource context to check on. The context usually matches the level of the action, which can be found in the permission catalog.

members.name: resourceId
members.doc:
Optional id of a specific resource. In case there was an assignment of a policy on a specific resource, the id of the resource should be passed here.
 The type of the resource will be derived from the permission catalog (each permission can have a resource type)

members.name: customAttributes
members.doc:
Set of key-value pairs. The attributes you pass with the call. If the policy was assigned without any condition, you don't need to pass any attributes.
 If the policy was assigned with a condition, in order to get `isPermitted = true` you need to pass the matching attributes.
 For example - in case there is an `msid` condition on one of the statements (common for account level actions assigned to contributors)
 you need to pass the `msid` the contributor is working on as an attribute, alongside an account resource context.

members.name: resourcesIsPermitted
members.doc: A map between a resource and the isPermitted result for each one

members.name: resource
members.doc: The queried resource

members.name: isPermitted
members.doc: The isPermitted result fot that resource

members.name: subject
members.doc: The subject to perform the isPermitted ofr

members.name: request
members.doc: The request of `isPermitted` the caller wants to perform

members.name: condition
members.doc: The type of the condition

members.name: joinedConditions
members.doc: A logic combination between several conditions, with an operator between them

members.name: condition
members.doc: A single condition

members.name: op
members.doc: The operator that should be used when evaluating the condition

members.name: conditions
members.doc: The conditions that should be evaluated, and then joined using the operator provided

members.name: conditionModelId
members.doc: The unique identifier of the condition model. Indicates which actions the condition is working on

members.name: operator
members.doc: The operator that should be evaluated

members.name: equals
members.doc: Comparison of equality - will be evaluated to true if the given parties are equal

members.name: like
members.doc: Regex operator - will be evaluated to true if the given value matches the provided regex

members.name: experiment
members.doc: Petri experiment - will be evaluated using petri.

members.name: dependOn
members.doc: Operator that indicates a dependency on another subject being allowed to perform something.

members.name: attrName
members.doc: The attribute which should be compared. The attribute will be first evaluated to a value, and then compared the other side (attribute/value)

members.name: value
members.doc: The value to compare to. If the two parties are equal - we will return true.

members.name: attrName
members.doc: The attribute which should be compared. The attribute will be first evaluated to a value, and then compared the regex values provided.

members.name: values
members.doc: The regex values which the attribute value should be evaluated on. If the attribute value matches at least one of the regular expressions provided - we will return true

members.name: spec
members.doc: The spec to conduct the experiment on.

members.name: fallbackValue
members.doc: The value to use if the experiment could not be conducted

members.name: expectedValue
members.doc: The expected value of the experiment conduction. If it matches the actual value - true will be returned. Otherwise - false.

docs.summary: Implies that the policy takes affect only if the depend on subject is permitted as well.

members.name: dependOnSubject
members.doc: The subject on which the current entry depends on. If the subject is allowed to perform what the query was about - the condition will be evaluated to true. Otherwise - false

members.name: attrName
members.doc: an attribute. We'll first retrieve the value of the attribute (from the request or from pre-indexed values), and then compare to what it needs to be compared with.

members.name: stringValue
members.doc: a value with a string type. Will be compared to the attribute provided, and be true only if they match the operator.

members.name: boolValue
members.doc: a value with a boolean type. Will be compared to the attribute provided, and be true only if they match the operator.

members.name: policy
members.doc: The policy to create

members.name: policy
members.doc: The created policy

messages.name: _com_wixpress_authorization_abac_management_UpdatePolicyAuthorizationDataRequest
messages.displayName: Update Policy Authorization Data Request Object

members.name: policyId
members.doc: The id of the policy to update

members.name: policyStatements
members.doc: A list of the new statements. They will override any existing statements.

members.name: policyId
members.doc: The id of the policy to update.

members.name: name
members.doc: The new name of the policy. If empty - the old name won't be overriden.

members.name: description
members.doc: The description of the policy. If empty - the old value won't be overriden.

members.name: status
members.doc: The status of the policy. Can be either "ACTIVE" or "INACTIVE".

members.name: updated
members.doc: Whether or not the update was successful (might not be successful in case the policy doesn't exist).

members.name: policy
members.doc: The updated policy

members.name: policyId
members.doc: The id of the policy to return

members.name: policy
members.doc: The full policy.

members.name: deleted
members.doc: Whether or not something was deleted.

members.name: statementId
members.doc: The statement id to delete.

members.name: deleted
members.doc: Whether or not something was deleted.

members.name: policy
members.doc: The update policy

members.name: subject
members.doc: The subject to assign to policy to.

members.name: policyId
members.doc: The id of the policy to assign.

members.name: resourceContext
members.doc: The context of the resource. It can be either site, account or organization.

members.name: condition
members.doc: A condition the is applied on the assignment. Can be a limit on some attribute that needs to be passed on isPermitted

members.name: resource
members.doc:
The resource you assign the policy to. Can be left empty in case of direct assignment on account/site.
 However, if it's a custom resource, it must be specified here.

members.name: assignmentId
members.doc: The unique id of the assignment.

messages.name: _com_wixpress_authorization_abac_management_UnassignPolicyFromSubjectRequest

members.doc: The subject to unassign to policy from.

members.name: policyId
members.doc: The policy id to unassign.

members.name: resourceContext
members.doc: From which resource context to unassign the policy.

members.name: resource
members.doc:
The resource you assign the policy to. Can be left empty in case of direct assignment on account/site.
 However, if it's a custom resource, it must be specified here.

members.name: policyId
members.doc: The id of the policy to find and fold the experiment on

members.doc: The spec to search and fold.

members.name: winningValue
members.doc: The winning value of the experiment, AKA the desired state.

members.name: assignmentId

members.name: condition

members.name: siteRestriction

Optional: Restrict the assignment to a specific site context.
 Adding such restriction means that the permissions that are included in the policy, will only be permitted for
 this specific site context.

members.name: condition

docs.summary:
Set of key-value pairs. A map of attributes and their values. If the subject has an assignment with a condition, you can provide here attribute values that will be calculated against the condition.
 For example, if you have an assignment with a condition where `A` = 3, when querying with `A`= 3 you will get the resource as one of the resources you are permitted to work on, but for `A` = "Banana" you won't get it.

members.name: key:value
members.doc: `key` of type string, `value` of type object

members.doc: If you want to get the permitted users that belong to a specific account, you can use this field with the desired account id.

members.name: resourceAttributes
members.doc:
Set of key-value pairs. A map of attributes and their values. If the subject has an assignment with a condition, you can provide here attribute values that will be calculated against the condition.
 For example, if you have an assignment with a condition where `A` = 3, when querying with `A`= 3 you will get the resource as one of the resources you are permitted to work on, but for `A` = "Banana" you won't get it.

members.name: subjectTypes
members.doc: An optional filter of requested subject types, If you want to get only accounts, for example, you can use this filter and avoid getting any other subject type

members.name: exceptPolicies
members.doc: A list of policy ids to filter out from the response

 For example, if you have an assignment with a condition where `A` = 3, when querying with `A`= 3 you will get the resource as one of the resources you are permitted to work on, but for `A` = "Banana" you won't get it.

 For example, if you have an assignment with a condition where `A` = 3, when querying with `A`= 3 you will get the resource as one of the resources you are permitted to work on, but for `A` = "Banana" you won't get it.

docs.summary:
Set of key-value pairs. A map of attributes and their values. If the subject has an assignment with a condition, you can provide here attribute values that will be calculated against the condition.
 For example, if you have an assignment with a condition where `A` = 3, when querying with `A`= 3 you will get the resource as one of the resources you are permitted to work on, but for `A` = "Banana" you won't get it.

messages.name: _com_wixpress_authorization_abac_query_GetSubjectPermittedResourcesRequest

members.name: action
members.doc: The action we query about. Notice that the action also determines the type of resource you are querying about.

members.name: resourcesFilter
members.doc: A filter for the resources. If you have in hand a list of resources and you want to query for only some of them, you can provide them here. We'll do a logic OR between the filters.

members.name: resourceAttributes
members.doc:
Set of key-value pairs. A map of attributes and their values. If the subject has an assignment with a condition, you can provide here attribute values that will be calculated against the condition.
 For example, if you have an assignment with a condition where `A` = 3, when querying with `A`= 3 you will get the resource as one of the resources you are permitted to work on, but for `A` = "Banana" you won't get it.

messages.displayName: Get Subject Permitted Resources Response Object

members.name: resources

messages.displayName: Get Subject Permitting Assignments Request Object

members.name: resourcesFilter
members.doc: A filter for the resources. If you have in hand a list of resources and you want to query for only some of them, you can provide them here. We'll do a logic OR between the filters.

members.name: actionsFilter
members.doc: Optional action filter. If you want only assignments (and scopes and actions) from a closed list - you can provide the actions here

messages.name: _com_wixpress_authorization_abac_query_GetSubjectPermittingAssignmentsResponse
messages.displayName: Get Subject Permitting Assignments Response Object

members.name: resources
members.doc: A map between a resource and the assignments the user has on the resource.

members.name: resource
members.doc: The tree describing the resource.

members.name: resourceConditions
members.doc: Condition that the subject might have to work on this resource. If the assignment contains a resource that was not calculated using the attributes passes, it will be returned here.

members.name: organizationContext
members.doc: Which organization the resource belongs to.

members.name: accountContext
members.doc: Which account the resource belongs to. It can be either a specific account or any account

members.name: siteContext
members.doc: Which site the resource belongs to. It can be a specific site or any site.

members.name: resource
members.doc: The custom resource. It can be a specific id or any. In cases where the resource is the site or the account, this field will be empty.

members.name: organizationContext
members.doc: A specific organization

members.name: all
members.doc: A wildcard meaning any organization

members.name: accountContext
members.doc: A specific account

members.name: all
members.doc: A wildcard meaning any account.

members.name: siteContext
members.doc: A specific site

members.name: all
members.doc: A wildcard meaning any site

members.name: resource
members.doc: A specific resource

members.name: all
members.doc: A wildcard meaning any resource

members.name: resource
members.doc: The tree describing the resource.

members.name: roles
members.doc: The roles that the subject has assigned on the resource.

members.name: subject
members.doc: The subject

members.name: rolesOnResources
members.doc: A map between the resource and the role he has on it

docs.summary:
Set of key-value pairs. A map of attributes and their values. If the subject has an assignment with a condition, you can provide here attribute values that will be calculated against the condition.
 For example, if you have an assignment with a condition where `A` = 3, when querying with `A`= 3 you will get the resource you queried about if the subject are permitted to work on, but for `A` = "Banana" you won't get it.

members.name: key:value
members.doc: `key` of type string, `value` of type object

members.name: resource
members.doc: Filter only for the specified resource

members.name: resourceAttributes
members.doc:
Set of key-value pairs. A map of attributes and their values. If the subject has an assignment with a condition, you can provide here attribute values that will be calculated against the condition.
 For example, if you have an assignment with a condition where `A` = 3, when querying with `A`= 3 you will get the resource you queried about if the subject are permitted to work on, but for `A` = "Banana" you won't get it.

members.name: organizationContext
members.doc: Filter only for the specified organization

members.name: accountResourceContext
members.doc: Filter only for the specific account

members.name: siteContext
members.doc: Filter only for the specified site

members.name: resource
members.doc: The tree describing the resource.

members.name: assignments
members.doc: The exact assignment the subject has the on the resource.

members.name: policyId
members.doc: The id of the policy the subject has assigned.

members.name: statements
members.doc: A list of all the statements he has assigned.

members.name: actions
members.doc: A list of all the actions the subject has as part of the statement. The actions will be flattened, no scopes here.

members.name: scopes
members.doc: A list of all scopes the subject has as part of the statement.

members.name: resourceConditions
members.doc: The conditions that the subject has as part of the statement. For example, one can do all the mentioned actions only between 3 to 4 PM.

docs.summary:
Possible values are:
  • UNKNOWN
  • ACCOUNT
  • USER
  • USER_GROUP
  • MEMBER_GROUP
  • VISITOR_GROUP
  • EXTERNAL_APP

Possible values are:
  • UNKNOWN_CTX
  • ORG_CTX
  • ACCOUNT_CTX

Possible values are:
  • UNKNOWN_SIMPLE_OP
  • EQUAL

Possible values are:
  • UNKNOWN_JOIN_OP
  • OR
  • AND

Possible values are:
  • UNKNOWN_STATUS
  • PREDEFINED
  • CUSTOM
  • INLINE_CUSTOM

Possible values are:
  • UNKNOWN_EFFECT
  • ALLOW
  • DENY

Possible values are:
  • WEAK
  • STRONG
